Configuration¶

Author:Juti Noppornpitak

The configuration in Tori framework is written on XML. The only reason is because it is validable and flexible. It is largely influenced by the extensive use of Beans in Spring Framework (Java) and the lazy loading in Doctrine (PHP).

Directive Description
include To include the settings from other files or modules.
server The settings for the built-in server.
port The port number that the built-in server listens to the requests.
route The routing settings for the application. See Routing.

Warning

The DTD is not available at the moment. Please follow the example and common sense.

Warning

include is not yet implemented.

Note

Like a prototype in Yotsuba project, yotsuba.kotoba.Kotoba is still used for parsing the XML. This will be replaced with the selector from Kotoba project.
